# Draft:Heinrich Emmanuel Merck Award

The Heinrich Emanuel Merck Award is a scientific prize awarded by Merck KGaA in memory of Heinrich Emanuel Merck (1794–1855), the founder of Merck. From 1988 - 2022 the award recognized excellence in analytical chemistry; since 2025 the award has pivoted to recognise achievements in the computational sciences.
Awardees
List of previous awardees
* 1988 Masataka Hiraide (University of Nagoya) and Otto S. Wolfbeis (University of Graz)
* 1990 Brian A. Bidlingmeyer (Millipore Corporation) and Reinhard Nießner (Technical University München)
* 1993 Aviv Amirav (University of Tel Aviv)
* 1996 D. Jed Harrison (University of Alberta) and Andreas Manz (Imperial College London)
* 1998 Renato Zenobi (ETH Zürich)
* 2000 Norman J. Dovich (University of Alberta)
* 2002 Jonathan V. Sweedler (University of Illinois)
* 2004 Yoshinobu Baba (Universität Tokushima)
* 2007 Alexander A. Makarov (Thermo Electron) and Shuming Nie (Emory University and Georgia Institute of Technology)
* 2010 Luisa Torsi (Universität Bari)
* 2012 Aaron Wheeler (Universität Toronto)
* 2015 Petra S. Dittrich (ETH Zürich)
* 2017 Francesco Ricci (Universität Tor Vergata)
* 2019 David Alsteens (Université Catholique de Louvain)
* 2022 Valérie Gabelica (Institut National de la Santé et de la Recherche Médical)
* 2025 Alán Aspuru-Guzik (University of Toronto)
